title: D.C. police ID man killed in Southeast shooting; 3 others wounded, 1 critical
content:
WASHINGTON (AP/WJLA) - A 23-year-old man is dead and three others injured after a shooting in Washington.
District of Columbia police say officers responded to a report of a shooting on the 2600 block of Douglas Place Southeast just after 11 p.m. on Saturday. Police say four adult male victims suffering from gunshot wounds were taken to local hospitals for treatment.
One of the victims, identified as Dwayne Gene Dillard, was pronounced dead at the hospital.
Police say one victim is in critical condition and two others suffered non-life threatening injuries.
Police are offering a $25,000 reward for information leading to an arrest and conviction in the case.
